topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0: Deploy the KVM Region Patch 2

body.p: This patch fixes the PCI Bus Assignment for VM Guest. This patch is applicable for all cloud topologies.
If you did not deploy this patch, TS_HP_15_Custom_PATCH_0002.patch during installation, perform the following steps.
Note: You can use the Horizon UI to see if the patch has been deployed. Select the regionkvm, then click Admin, then System, and Inventory. Click the Patches table.
body.section:
Download the patch
If you have not downloaded the patch, launch the Helion Distribution Network (HDN). You must obtain a user account on HDN in order to download these files. In a browser, navigate to Helion Download Network(HDN).
Click Sign In to log in using your account.
After signing in, click the Downloads link in the menu on the left side of the page.
Download the file and the associated checksum and signature files.
Verify the downloaded signature and the downloaded checksums.
Extract the compressed files until the TS_HP_15_Custom_PATCH_0002.patch, readme.txt and usecase.txt files are available.

Install the patchExecute the following commands:
Patch the standby controller
Important: Make sure the KVM Region Custom Patch has been applied.
SSH into the active controller in the KVM region.
For example: controller-0.
Create a directory for the patch, if the directory does not exist:mkdir -p /tmp/patches
Copy the following patch file to the /tmp/patches directory:
TS_HP_15_Custom_PATCH_0002.patch
Execute the following commands: sudo sw-patch upload /tmp/patches/TS_HP_15_Custom_PATCH_0002.patch
Execute the following command to verify that the patch is available:sudo sw-patch query
Execute the following command to verify the current state of all the hosts:sudo sw-patch query-hosts
Execute the following command to deploy the patch:sudo sw-patch apply TS_HP_15_Custom_PATCH_0002.patch
Execute the following command to set the environment variables in the OpenStack RC file:source /etc/nova/openrc
Execute the following command to patch and reboot the standby controller: system host-patch-reboot <controller-#>
Wait until the rebooted controller node comes up after patching.
For example if controller-1 is the standby controller:system host-patch-reboot controller-1
Execute the following command to switch the active controller from the specifed controller: system host-swact controller-#
For example, switch the active controller from controller-0 to controller-1:system host-swact controller-0
Exit the SSH session and SSH into the newly active controller.
Execute the following command to set the environment variables in the OpenStack RC file:source /etc/nova/openrc
Patch the new standby controller
Log onto the newly active controller and patch the standby controller.
SSH into the newly active controller.
For example: controller-1.
Execute the following command: source /etc/nova/openrc
Execute the following command to patch and reboot the standby controller: system host-patch-reboot <controller-#>
For example if controller-0 is the standby controller:system host-patch-reboot controller-0
Reboot both compute nodes:system host-patch-reboot compute-0 system host-patch-reboot compute-1
